data.title: Atom Process does not close after workspace::scan completes
data.body:
On windows 10, when calling the atom.workspace.scan function, a process is created and doesn't terminate even after it is finished finding matches.

This can be tested by running this line: 
atom.workspace.scan(/(a)+/, function(result){})

Edit: Looks like it was a package I had installed

data.title: :arrow_up: language-go@0.34.0
data.body: Updating the language package to the latest version.

data.title: Currently remember application state isn't working in Windows
data.body:
If you have multiple windows open in Atom for multiple projects they don't open both windows when closing.  

It would be awesome if you could re-open the Windows or remember Project states and just re-open the projects to the existing states.  I read the news announcement that this was done, but it appears the feature was only done for OSX?  Not Linux or Windows?

data.title: Available Updates: icon for git repo is broken
data.body:
Atom 1.0.3 / Mac

When updating packages, the repo icon is always broken. Have observed for a few weeks assuming it would clear up, but it's still happening with every package. Looks like this:

![screen shot 2015-07-30 at 11 12 55 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/214924/9000104/c49af374-3710-11e5-9027-1708ffba2aae.png)

data.title: Update language-c, java, javascript, and yaml
data.body:
- language-c updates `this` to be `variable.language.this.c`
- language-java now tokenizes comments in enums and updates `this` to be `variable.language.this.java`
- language-javascript fixes a major regression with const highlighting
- language-yaml fixes more issues with multiline text blocks

data.title: Vertical line appearing at middle of editor
data.body:
In my editor a vertical line start appearing in middle of editor, I tired to clear .atom files in home directory and reinstalled the application but nothing worked.
I am using Ubuntu 14.04 64bit.

data.title: Atom freezes when interacting with packages in Settings
data.body:
Almost every time I open Settings and go to packages to do something, it'll freeze. If I search for a package that isn't there, sometimes when I open a package to see it's settings, sometimes just opening the package view before I even do anything it'll freeze.

Win7 x64 Atom 1.0.3 all packages fully updated.

data.title: Update docs for Gutter
Atom makes numerous requests on start / offers no way to disable
data.body:
Upon running Atom (on Mac OS 10.9+), I have noticed it wants to connect to the following URLs:
- atom.io on TCP port 443 (https)
- 2001:4860:4860::8888 on UDP port 53 (domain) and (Reverse DNS: google-public-dns-a.google.com)
- s3-1.amazonaws.com on port 443 (https)
- maps.gstatic.com on port 443 (https)
- www-google-analytics.l.google.com on TCP port 443 (https) and (193.229.108.55)

I assumed the first couple were to just check if there were any updates, but the calls to Google have me stumped as to why my local app needs to ping Google. I searched the codebase and didn't find any mention of these URLs.

Perhaps you can explain these requests (or already have somewhere). Additionally, It seems that offering users a way to opt-out / disable these requests would be desirable, especially for the more privacy conscious users.

data.title: Tab inconsistent between Linux and Windows.
data.body: Today I was on Windows 10 debugging an issue with Jekyll and opened a file (that is not related) and noticed that when I opened that tab delimited file the alignment was off because on Linux Atom editor defaults to 8 space tabs but on Windows Atom editor defaults to 2 space tabs, this results in a massive misalignment of sources that use tabs between the two operating systems.

data.title: Working on atom internals -> Building
data.body:
I started working on a feature in atom's core yesterday and I was wondering what your workflow is. Running `scripts/build` after making a change is very slow - is there some kind of grunt watcher task that automatically recompiles the coffee and lets you reload the editor?

If you tell me how it works, I can make a PR modifying the docs for better understanding of the workflow

data.title: Atom hangs when given long, non-standard HTML files
data.body:
It's kind of illegal "html" that Honeywell's Experion HMI WebBuilder spits out.

It typically starts out like this:

``` html
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<HTML xmlns:v = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml" xmlns:o = 
"urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" xmlns:p = 
"urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:powerpoint" xmlns:w = 
"urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:word"><HEAD><TITLE></TITLE>
<META content="text/html; charset=windows-1252" http-equiv=Content-Type>
<META name=DisplayVersion-PS content=6.11>
<META name=HMIWebTemplateDescription content="Create a blank HMIWeb display.">
<STYLE>v\:* {
    BEHAVIOR: url(#default#VML)
}
o\:* {
    BEHAVIOR: url(#default#VML)
}
p\:* {
    BEHAVIOR: url(#default#VML)
}
w\:* {
    BEHAVIOR: url(#default#VML)
}
.shape {
    BEHAVIOR: url(#default#VML)
}
</STYLE>

<OBJECT style="POSITION: absolute; WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 0px; TOP: 0px; LEFT: 0px" 
id=HDXPageBehavior codeBase="" 
classid=clsid:1234ABCD-56EF-1234-5678-90ABCDEF0123></OBJECT>
```

and only goes downhill from there. You'll see about 12000 lines of VBScript tags, which begin like:

``` html
<SCRIPT language=VBScript for="" type="" defer event="">'--------------------------------------
'Scada RegCntl - Mode; Hialm Type; EUDesc; 
'--------------------------------------
```

and are only terminated by `</SCRIPT>`. You'll see `id`, `class`, and other custom attributes whose values aren't quoted, despite containing non-alphanumeric characters and punctuation, like `id=shape005 class=hsc.shape.1 tabIndex=-1`. And you'll see other, similar abuses.

Which is fine, but the HTML syntax highlighter should be more accommodating, and more importantly Atom shouldn't hang and crash when scrolling through this.

data.title: Update Atom package for Windows/Chocolatey
data.body:
The [package for Atom](https://chocolatey.org/packages/Atom) on Chocolatey is woefully outdated and poorly behaved, and it needn't be.

Atom shouldn't use an installer for its Windows package. This excludes Squirrel, InstallShield, MSI, and anything else that touches the registry or creates shortcuts. Instead, its package should unarchive its [Windows zip release](https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/download/v1.0.3/atom-windows.zip) into the folder Chocolatey gives it, like [most other packages](https://github.com/chocolatey/chocolatey-coreteampackages/blob/master/automatic/autohotkey.portable/tools/chocolateyInstall.ps1).

Moreover, Chocolatey is for installing packages globally via script, not on a per-user basis. It's orthogonal to [the Squirrel installer](https://atom.io/download/windows). By randomly installing to the `~/AppData/Local/atom` of the current user, Atom blocks other users from accessing it, defeating the purpose of package management, and preventing users and organizations from deploying Atom on servers or across multiple machines via Chocolatey (I wanted to do exactly this recently).

Changing Atom's Chocolatey package to install a zipfile fixes all of this.

data.title: Please consider an option to disable plugin warnings, at least temporarily
data.body:
My eslint plugin is currently throwing warnings every time I hit a key, but only when working in the eslint project itself.

I'm fine with the plugin being broken, I'm not fine with it taking up half of my screen with a giant red warning box that I can't ever dismiss (because whenever I type anything another one just pops up).

I'm not sure what the best solution is here, or if there is one in place already (I couldn't find it), but I'd suggest something along the lines of chrome's "prevent additional alert messages" option that would disable all warnings from that plugin until the editor is restarted, projects switched, or some other trigger.

data.title: :arrow_up: deprecation-cop@0.54.0
data.body: This now hides deprecation-cop's status bar view unless the window is in dev mode. https://github.com/atom/deprecation-cop/pull/64

data.title: :arrow_up: tree-view@0.181.0
data.body: This fixes an issue with VCS coloring if the project root was a symlink. (https://github.com/atom/tree-view/pull/487)

data.title: Add native feature to Sign-in and Sync Settings to GitHub account
data.body: I've tried a few plugins, like the sync-settings one - and they're good. But native support would be ideal. Atom is a great GitHub product, and I'd like to see more GitHub integration.

data.title: :arrow_up: marked@0.3.4
data.body: `marked` 0.3.4 was just released, which resolves a [security vulnerability](https://nodesecurity.io/advisories/marked_redos). Although 0.3.4 was already satisfying the semver version range, this bumps the minimum version to be more explicit (and hopefully make [David](https://david-dm.org/atom/atom)'s `insecure` status go away :stuck_out_tongue_closed_eyes:)

data.title: Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token :
data.body:
As far as I can tell I only needed to open a file to cause this.

**Atom Version**: 1.0.3
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.5
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token :

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:8587

SyntaxError: Unexpected token :
  at [object Object].Tooltip.getPosition (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/bootstrap/js/tooltip.js:365:61)
  at [object Object].Tooltip.show (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/bootstrap/js/tooltip.js:210:31)
  at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/bootstrap/js/tooltip.js:135:41

```

data.title: Prevent end-of-word search from scanning whole buffer
data.body:
Refs #8123

This was causing long pauses when selecting by word with the mouse in certain locations.

data.title: Not sure 1.0.3 correctly upgraded in-place
data.body:
I'm on a Mac. If I open About Atom or run `atom --version`, it says **1.0.3**. If I open the Release Notes section (from the Help menu), it says **1.0.2** with the normal button to "Restart and update."

Trouble is, if I click that, Atom will never relaunch. When I next launch it manually (in regular, dev or safe mode), I'm back to the scenario above.

It seems Atom is confused. How can I help it?

data.title: Allow custom association between file names and grammars
data.body: Closes #1718

data.title: On screen keyboard opens when hardware keyboard is present
data.body:
Tapping a text area to move focus in Atom opens the OSK, even with a hardware keyboard connected.

This looks related to a longstanding issue in Chromium (which now works correctly, tested in Chrome v44): https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=335735

What has to happen for the fix to make its way to Atom? It's a bit maddening to run on a Surface as-is.

data.title: Upgrade Squirrel for Windows
data.body: Long time coming, upgrades to Squirrel for Windows 0.99.3 via upgrading the grunt plugin for creating electron installers.

data.title: Fix bug where word- and line-wise selections got stuck in reversed state
data.body: Refs #8123

data.title: Add option to make temporary file backups when saving
data.body:
Fixes #3158

@atom/feedback It would be great if you could enable this option once this lands to see if we're encountering unexpected issues with backup files.

data.title: Pop Up Showing the Opening Tag in HTML
data.body:
This was the third part of the issue #7938.
#### Pop up showing the opening tag in HTML

Clicking on a closing HTML tag shows the opening tag and its class(es), id(s), line number in a popup. It would be much more helpful than using _go to the matching bracket_.

![pop-up](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11135104/8740520/6112274e-2c68-11e5-9b29-9a049a642470.gif)

data.title: Linux Mint freezes when using Atom
data.body:
Somewhat randomly, but annoyingly frequently, my Linux Mint/Cinnamon installation crashes, and I think the issue may well be related to atom. 

**Symptoms**: The whole windows manager freezes and blacks out, except for the mouse, and I may or may not be able to restart with Ctrl+Alt+Backspace or by opening a tty with Ctr+Alt+F1 and killing cinnammon. 

The last line of /var/sys/log always looks like this immediately after the crash:
Jul 29 15:50:40 ulises-ubuntu acpid: client 9595[0:0] has disconnected

but in addition .xsession-errors seems to point out to Atom (see below)

It often, but not always, happens while swtiching apps with Alt+Tab.

**System data:**
Linux Mint 17.1 32 bit
![captura de pantalla de 2015-07-29 16 50 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4282554/8960849/3b4e39a4-3612-11e5-971f-c0173ac1032f.png)

Atom version (according to Synaptic): 1.0.0-1~webupd8~0
Or from the terminal:

~ $ atom --version
1.0.0 
~ $ cinnamon --version
Cinnamon 2.4.8
~ $ uname -a
Linux ulises-ubuntu 3.13.0-37-generic #64-Ubuntu SMP Mon Sep 22 21:30:01 UTC 2014 i686 i686 i686 GNU/Linux

**Why I think it may be caused by atom:**

The last few lines of .xsession-errors right after the crash are always like the last lines in the following log excerpt (where I include the log from the start of the session in case something else may be relevant)

/etc/mdm/Xsession: Beginning session setup...
localuser:alvaro being added to access control list

Script para auto iniciada en run_im.
Script para default iniciada en run_im.

Failed to connect to the VirtualBox kernel service
Failed to connect to the VirtualBox kernel service
Script para ibus iniciada en run_im.
Script para auto iniciada en run_im.
Script para default iniciada en run_im.
GNOME_KEYRING_CONTROL=/run/user/1000/keyring-WrPb0S
GNOME_KEYRING_CONTROL=/run/user/1000/keyring-WrPb0S
GPG_AGENT_INFO=/run/user/1000/keyring-WrPb0S/gpg:0:1
GNOME_KEYRING_CONTROL=/run/user/1000/keyring-WrPb0S
GPG_AGENT_INFO=/run/user/1000/keyring-WrPb0S/gpg:0:1
GNOME_KEYRING_CONTROL=/run/user/1000/keyring-WrPb0S
GPG_AGENT_INFO=/run/user/1000/keyring-WrPb0S/gpg:0:1
SSH_AUTH_SOCK=/run/user/1000/keyring-WrPb0S/ssh

*\* (nemo:2469): WARNING **: Can not determine workarea, guessing at layout

data.title: CTRL + Click to Open File
data.body:
This was the second part of the issue #7938. I split it into 2 issues, as suggested by @mnquintana and @izuzak.
#### CTRL + Click to open file in editor

Holding down CTRL and left clicking a file in the current editor tab, opens the file in a new tab (or, switches to the tab).

![ctrl-click](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11135104/8740156/050d81b4-2c63-11e5-9a5d-78ff63c4c772.gif)
